text:
Dorothy Catherine Fontana (March 25, 1939 – December 2, 2019) was an American television script writer and story editor. He was best known for her work on the original "Star Trek" franchise and several Western television series. She also wrote the script for "Logan's Run", "The Six Million Dollar Man", and "Buck Rogers in the 25th Century". Fontana was born in Sussex, New Jersey.
Fontana died on December 2, 2019 after a short battle with cancer in Burbank, California, aged 80.
